Ingredients: 

For the Filling: 

• 1 pound ground beef (or your choice of protein) 
• 1 medium onion, finely chopped 
• 2 cloves garlic, minced 
• 1 packet of taco seasoning mix or make your own with chili powder, cumin, paprika, and oregano 
• 1 cup diced tomatoes (canned or fresh) 
• Salt and pepper to taste 
• Cooking oil 

For Assembling: 

• 10 small soft taco shells or tortillas 
• Shredded lettuce 
• Diced tomatoes 
• Grated cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese 
• Sliced jalapeños (optional) 
• Sour cream 
• Salsa 
• Guacamole 
• Sliced black olives (optional) 
• Sliced green onions (optional) 

Procedure: 

1. Prepare the Filling: 

• In a skillet, heat a small amount of cooking oil over medium-high heat. 
• Add the chopped onions and garlic and sauté until they become translucent. 
• Add the ground beef (or your choice of protein) and cook it, breaking it apart with a spatula, until it's browned and cooked through. 
• Drain any excess fat from the skillet. 
• Add the taco seasoning mix (or your homemade seasoning blend) and diced tomatoes. Stir well and cook for a few minutes until the mixture is heated through. 
• Season with salt and pepper to taste. 

2. Assemble the Tacos: 

• Warm the taco shells or tortillas according to the package instructions or by heating them in a dry skillet for a few seconds on each side. 
• Place the warm taco shells on serving plates or a platter. 
• Spoon the cooked filling into the taco shells, dividing it evenly among them. 
• Top each taco with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, grated cheese, and any other desired toppings like jalapeños, sour cream, salsa, guacamole, black olives, or green onions. 

3. Serve: 

• Serve the tacos hot and let each member customize their taco with their preferred toppings. 


Enjoy your homemade tacos for 5 members! You can also offer a variety of protein options like grilled chicken, pulled pork, or sautéed shrimp to cater to different tastes.
